I understand how late this is in the process and how frustrating the uncertainty is. If we reach a definitive point where we are unable to finalize with those higher-priority candidates and the seat is released, we would reassess immediately at that time.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

[REJECT]

To remain consistent with priorities and maximize chance of higher-ranked match, I should reject again and keep the seat open rather than lock in E.

Dear School_C Admissions,

I’m writing in Round 28 to submit a formal application once more and to reaffirm—without any conditions—that School_C remains my first choice. If you are able to extend an offer at any point, I will accept immediately and enroll.

Given how late we are in the process and that the seat is still unfinalized, could you please share whether the higher-priority conversations have reached a final yes/no, and whether you expect the seat to be released to the next candidate in line within this round?

Thank you again for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_E

Despite repeated rejections due to priority, the school is still unfinalized late in the process; continuing to apply keeps me visible the moment the seat is released. Thank you for your Round 28 application and for your continued patience and clear commitment to School_C.

Given where we are in the process, we are prepared to finalize our remaining seat with you. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_C, and we understand you will accept and enroll immediately.

Sincerely,
